â€¢ Facilitate 8-week (curriculum based) formal and informal workshops and learning experiences for large and small groups of parents or guardians of K-12 students â€¢ Define learning goals for each training initiative that helps families gain the tools and confidence to join forces with schools and communities to make sure their children have successful academic careers and are prepared for higher educationâ€¢ Illustrate the tools, knowledge and confidence parents need to help their children achieve academic success in order to become effective partners with their school, other parents and the community to help make a better school for all childrenâ€¢ Illustrate ways parents can prevent dropouts, how to build on their childrenâ€™s learning styles, the important of monitoring homework, ways to build study skills and how to improve test-taking skillsâ€¢ Coordinate and perform administrative functions necessary to deliver and document learning and skill development program to track progress of participantsâ€¢ Compile tests and other evaluations to be used to measure learning and performanceTopics covered include:You Make the Difference!Being a Partner with Your SchoolAcademic Standards and Performance RequirementsSchool Success Factors â€“ Communication and DisciplineSchool Success Factors â€“ Self-Esteem and MotivationSchool Success Factors â€“ Reading, Together Time and PlanningYour Academic Success Plan

Goodwill of Central and Northern Arizona

Our MissionThrough the goodwill of others, we are able to create a better future for all by fighting unemployment in Arizona and helping those who desire self-sufficiency.â–ª Travel to program sites throughout Maricopa Countyâ–ª Train and assist in the development of new and current career center staff, volunteers, and Senior program participantsâ–ª Conduct accurate skills appraisals and prepare job seekers 16 years and older for the current job market by assisting them with the completion of applications and resumesâ–ª Provide 1-on-1 career advisement by coaching job seekers on interviewing techniques, job searching skills, career development strategies, and industry trendsâ–ª Identify job seeker talents and skills, and effectively matches them to available internal and external employment opportunities, employers, and trainingâ–ª Facilitate career coaching workshops designated to strengthen job seekerâ€™s professional skills and growthâ–ª Maintain databases and records of services provided to job seekers, including employment events, job placements, case notes, and support services issuedâ–ª Promote all hiring and job readiness events both within the career center and off-site locationsâ–ª Collaborate with community partners and drive rapid job attainment and word-of-mouth referralsâ–ª Promote Goodwill services by conducting outbound calls and by working off-site events held by our Employee Experience and Community Experience Partnersâ–ª Refer job seekers to external agencies for services such as literacy, child care, food/shelter, etc.By working with both job seekers and local employers, Goodwill of Central Arizona is able to place tens of thousands of Arizonans in jobs each year. None of this would be possible without your donations.  You help support job placement and skills training at numerous career centers that are free to the public. It also helps the environment by diverting millions of pounds of material out of our local landfills.

summary: Four main factors continue to help me form positive, life-changing choices; my growth mindset, a trustworthy group of supporters, opportunities for growth in my community, and failure.   The skills and talents I develop through opportunities I participate in are what continue to give me the confidence and courage to carry on my pursuit to educate and empower my community on the various ways to obtain self-sufficiency.I welcome failure in my life.  Failure is a valuable teacher that reminds me that I'm human and still growing.My educational background and work experience is a mix of Early Childhood Development, Elementary Education, Adult Learning and Entrepreneurship.   I am well acquainted with general practices, principles and philosophical aspects of program development and administration.  I have sound knowledge on leadership development that includes emotional support, skill development, and community involvement.I'm open to learning new ways to grow professionally and strengthen my community involvement, let's chat!
